title: Howie Hawkins
deleted: Hawkins was critical of his Democratic opponent, [[Andrew Cuomo]], and challenged him to participate in public forums with the other gubernatorial candidates. In a ''[[New York Daily News]]'' interview, Hawkins expressed his concerns with some of Cuomo's positions:

... he [Cuomo] wants to solve the state budget crisis by cutting spending such as for state workers and schools. He ignores that the root cause of the problem is not spending but the huge tax cuts for the wealthy that began when he was helping his father as Governor. Instead of spending caps, we need the wealthy and Wall Street to pay their fair share.Katz, Celeste {{cite news | title=Green Party's Howie Hawkins Weighs In On Cuomo | url=http://www.nydailynews.com/blogs/dailypolitics/2010/05/green-partys-howie-hawkins-wei.html | accessdate=July 4, 2010 | location=New York | work=Daily News | first=Celeste | last=Katz | date=May 22, 2010 | url-status=dead | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100524020740/http://www.nydailynews.com/blogs/dailypolitics/2010/05/green-partys-howie-hawkins-wei.html | archivedate=May 24, 2010 | df=mdy-all }} ''The New York Daily News'', May 22, 2010
